answers.answer: With my 3rd pregnancy they told me I was low starting at 15 weeks. Again they said it was minimal. I stayed that way until I delivered. I was induced 2 weeks early because of other complications that weren't related. :) no panicking until you have to. It's totally possible to have a good outcome.
Thank you so much. I have had a bad run when it comes to pregnancies. My first went well. Then I had 4 miscarriages. Then I had complication after complication with my daughter
This is my 5th child (8th pregnancy. Or 7th depending on how you look at it). Complications are my normal to. :) no fears
This is child #3, 7th pregnancy so I completely understand.

I was low as well and was induced four weeks early and the baby was fine at birth. But did need a small procedure at a week old Vic he was drinking the fluid but unable to pee it out from a small blockage but he is turning 8 soon and perfectly healthy
My sister had the same issue and she just had to be monitored more then normal. She carried full term and my nephew was a healthy 8lb baby. He is5 now. Best wishes :)

With my first i had low fluid and it was not just minimal it scared the ob they mobitored me two to three times a week. He tured out fine caried to term and came out healthy. I was a nervous wreck when they told me but i just paid attention to his movements and if he didn't move within a certain time period i went to the er but he was always fine.

I had low fluid also. You can get your fluid back up by drinking extra fluids you need 64 ounces of water a day. Plus while your fluid is low drink 2 extra glasses of water. Stay away from caffeine. Don't worry and drink drink drink. Summer is hard on a pregnancy. I delivered at 35 weeks due to preeclampsia.

My cousin had the same problem when she was pregnant with her 2nd. The doc was concerned and monitored her.  She was induced about a week or 2 before her due date to be safe. The baby was born perfectly healthy. She's 5 now. Stay positive I'm sure all will be fine. Good luck

My son was almost dry when he came out he had a pocket around his head and one around his tummy he was 2 weeks late and they didnt know till I was in to get induced but he's 10 now and he's fine he had to be covered in baby oil for the first week but he was fine

question: So, at my visit to the hospital they noticed a was a little low on amniotic fluid. Not dangerously low though. I think 3-4mm less than average. Of course though I'm scaring myself thinking the first. I'm 17+5. Please, I need some success stories. All I'm reading are the sad ones and I can't handle it anymore.
title: Freaking myself out
